pages.text: One of the trickier parts of playing in a band is setting the arrangement. Each MIDI file that you might play will have a different configuration of which MIDI programs are assigned to which channels.$(br2)A general recommendation for is to have the Maestro examine the MIDI file in the playback software (or another program) and see which MIDI program is assigned to each channel.

The Maestro can then inform the rest of their band members of the channel programs and have them enable MIDI channels in their instrument(s) that most closely align to the program on each channel in the file A player with a guitar may choose to enable the channels mapped to Acoustic Guitar and Acoustic Bass, for example. $(br2)While multiple band members can enable the same channels it usually sounds more balanced to only have one instrument for each channel.
